definition: to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: What he says is ridiculous, yet many people echo his words.
sentences.chinese: 他的講話真荒唐，但有很多人隨聲附和。

sentences.english: They echoed every word of their leader.
sentences.chinese: 他們隨聲附和他們領導人的每句話。

sentences.english: He echoed every word of his superior.
sentences.chinese: 隨聲附和他上級的每一句話。

sentences.english: “Yeah, the same, ” Matthew echoed, a dim grin on his face.
sentences.chinese: “是啊，一樣，”馬修隨聲附和，臉上笑意隱約。

sentences.english: Only my voice took up the tunes, and my heart danced in their cadence.
sentences.chinese: 我只隨聲附和，我的心應節跳舞。

sentences.english: If Kyl agrees, the majority of the caucus will follow suit.
sentences.chinese: 假如凱爾同意，核心會議的多數人會隨聲附和。

sentences.english: What he said is ridiculous, but many people echoed his words.
sentences.chinese: 他的講話真荒唐，但竟然有很多人隨聲附和。

sentences.english: They echoed every word of their leader .
sentences.chinese: 他們隨聲附和他們首領的每一句話。
